intro: Glossopetalon spinescens var. spinescens, commonly known as the spiny glossopetalon, is a perennial shrub native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its woody stems and dense clusters of small, spiny leaves that provide structural support and reduce water loss. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers during the cooler months, which are typically visited by specific pollinators. Its adaptations to harsh, dry environments include deep root systems and a reduced leaf surface area. This variant is notable for its distinctive spines and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
